question_sentence: Which word did Donald Trump use to refer to his political enemies during his Veterans Day speech?
evidence: During a nearly two-hour Veterans Day address in New Hampshire last weekend, the former US leader vowed to “root out” opponents who “live like vermin within the confines of our country”. His speech was condemned by critics including Joe Biden, who warned that Trump's rhetoric was reminiscent of that used by the Nazis.

question_sentence: Which late celebrity is being "brought back to life" using AI in order to narrate a biopic?
evidence: Warner Music Group has announced that artificial intelligence will be used to recreate the "voice and image" of the "La Vie en Rose" singer, who died in 1963, for the upcoming 90-minute biopic. Titled "Edith", the film is billed to tell the story of how she became “a symbol of female empowerment and one of France's most iconic artists of all time”.

question_sentence: Thousands of people were evacuated from the Icelandic town of Grindavik amid fears of an eruption by which volcano?
evidence: Iceland has recorded hundreds of small earthquakes this week, with tens of thousands of tremors reported in the southwest region of Reykjanes. Scientists warned of a "high" chance that the tremors could disrupt the volcano, which is about 12 miles north of Grindavik.

question_sentence: Which UK parcel delivery company delivers the worst customer service, according to a new study?
evidence: A Citizens Advice-commissioned survey of more than 8,000 people found that more than one in three had experienced a delivery problem with the last parcel they received. Evri, formerly Hermes, was reported to be the worst provider, followed by Yodel.

question_sentence: Xi Jinping met with Joe Biden in which city during the Chinese leader's first visit to the US in six years?
evidence: The two leaders met on Wednesday on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (Apec) summit, in a bid to stabilise US-China relations. Find out more about why Apec matters with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How much did “The Marvels” make at the box office in the film's opening weekend?
evidence: The superhero film, which reportedly cost $250 million to make, scored the lowest opening-weekend takings in the 15-year history of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. By comparison, 2019's “Captain Marvel” debuted with $153 million.

question_sentence: What was the final score in last weekend's Premier League classic clash between Chelsea and Manchester City?
evidence: Chelsea's Cole Porter scored the equalising goal against his former club in a 95th-minute penalty, following a nail-biting clash at London's Stamford Bridge that saw City lead three times.

question_sentence: Which US institution this week released its first-ever code of conduct?
evidence: The most powerful legal body in the US has issued ethics rules governing its nine justices amid increasing scrutiny following reports of undisclosed property deals and gifts. In a one-sentence press release, the court said the code was merely the "codification of principles that we have long regarded as governing our conduct".

question_sentence: A lion prowled the streets of which Italian seaside town last weekend after escaping from a circus?
evidence: Video footage posted on social media showed the lion, called Kimba, prowling the streets of the resort town, near Rome, on Saturday night after escaping from a local circus. Residents were warned to stay at home while police and circus staff tried to capture the eight-year-old big cat, which was eventually cornered and sedated. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Who became the UK's sixth health secretary since the 2019 elections?
evidence: The former criminal barrister was appointed as Steve Barclay's successor during Rishi Sunak's cabinet reshuffle on Monday. Atkins previously served as financial secretary to the Treasury.

question_sentence: Thousands of people participated in a pro-Israel protest this week in which city?
evidence: A massive pro-Israel demonstration took place Tuesday on the National Mall in Washington, DC. The march is believed to be the largest pro-Israel gathering in the US since the start of the Israel-Hamas war.

question_sentence: State labs recently found “extremely high” levels of lead in which popular snack food?
evidence: Multiple lots of cinnamon-flavored applesauce products were recalled following several cases of high blood lead levels in children. There have been nearly two dozen cases across 14 states, the CDC said.

question_sentence: Which city was forced to close one of its busiest freeways due to a major fire?
evidence: A large fire forced the indefinite closure of a part of Interstate 10, one of the busiest traffic arteries in Los Angeles. The massive blaze was started intentionally, California Gov. Gavin Newsom said.

question_sentence: Diwali, one of the biggest festivals in India, was celebrated this week with much fervor. What is the holiday also known as?
evidence: More than a billion Hindus, Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists around the world celebrated Diwali, also known as the festival of lights.

question_sentence: Which country declared a state of emergency this week over the threat of a possible volcanic eruption?
evidence: Around 1,000 earthquakes recently hit Iceland within a 24-hour span. The world-famous Blue Lagoon thermal pool in the area was forced to temporarily close due to the ongoing seismic activity.

question_sentence: Which government institution announced a code of conduct this week in an attempt to address ethics concerns?
evidence: The Supreme Court on Monday adopted a code of conduct. This comes after months of news stories alleging that conservative Justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel Alito accepted lavish gifts and took part in other controversial off-bench activities.

question_sentence: Which company is planning to label “realistic” AI-generated content?
evidence: YouTube will soon require disclosures on videos that contain content generated by artificial intelligence and could mislead viewers.

question_sentence: Which celebrity will host the 2024 Academy Awards?
evidence: Comedian Jimmy Kimmel will be returning to host the Oscars for the fourth time.

question_sentence: Which state is asking for help in redesigning its flag?
evidence: Minnesota has received more than 2,600 design submissions for its new state flag. The change comes as the current Minnesota state flag has long drawn criticism for both its design and its depiction of Indigenous Americans.

question_sentence: Which animal recently escaped from a circus near Rome?
evidence: A lion that escaped from a traveling circus near Rome was recaptured after several hours on the loose.

question_sentence: Which of the following statements about traveling to Puerto Rico from Wilmington Airport is FALSE?
choices: U.S. citizens do not need a passport to fly to San Juan.
Visitors will be required to pass through the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s check before returning to the continental U.S.
The west side of Puerto Rico is known for having some of the best beaches on the island.

question_sentence: What contributed to Delaware win against Del State in college basketball?
choices: Delaware's dominant start in the first half.
Delaware's efficient scoring during the entire game.

question_sentence: What enabled Anthony Papiro, a visually impaired runner, to qualify for the Delaware high school cross country championship meet?
choices: The use of a guide runner during races.
His participation in the wrestling team before transitioning to running.
The gene therapy injections he received to stabilize his vision.

question_sentence: How was the beer "Blue Hen Haze" created?
choices: Blue Hen Haze was developed by a group of Delaware high school students as part of a community initiative.
The beer was a spontaneous creation by Iron Hill Brewery's staff inspired by the University of Delaware's Blue Hens.
The beer was a result of a partnership between Iron Hill Brewery and an undergraduate course at the University of Delaware's College of Agriculture and Natural Resources.

question_sentence: Why is Delaware state Rep. Ruth Briggs King resigning from her legislative seat?
choices: She is retiring from politics after serving for 14 years.
She is dissatisfied with the recent changes in Delaware's district lines.
She is moving to a new home outside of the 37th District she currently represents.

question_sentence: What prompted a Secret Service agent to open fire on Sunday in Washington's Georgetown neighborhood?
choices: An attempt to protect President Joe Biden.
An incident involving a break-in into a Secret Service vehicle assigned to protect Naomi Biden.
A suspicious package near the presidential motorcade.

question_sentence: Why did former Delaware Auditor Kathy McGuiness appeal to the Delaware Supreme Court?
choices: To challenge her misdemeanor public corruption conviction.
To appeal her loss in the fall primary for re-election.
To sue Attorney General Kathy Jennings.

question_sentence: What is the primary issue discussed in the article " 'Beats living on the streets:' The Delawareans who call motels home during the holidays"?
choices: The challenges faced by individuals living in motels during the holidays, including lack of housing options.
The efforts of outreach groups to provide food, clothing, and toys to motel residents during the holidays.
The specific circumstances of Cheryl Dayton, a motel resident, and her transition to affordable housing.

question_sentence: What prompted calls for campaign finance reform in Delaware according to the article "How Hall-Long's refusal to release audit findings sparked elections reform talks"?
choices: Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long's decision to conduct an audit on her campaign finances.
The lack of transparency in Delaware's campaign finance laws and the need for more frequent reporting.
Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long's announcement of her bid for Delaware governor in 2024.

question_sentence: Why did the Rehoboth Beach Christmas tree end up being shorter than usual, at 25 feet, instead of the intended 40 feet?
choices: The tree had a natural growth limit, reaching only 25 feet in height.
The tree broke in two during transport, and city officials decided to use only the upper two-thirds of the tree.
The original tree was mistakenly cut shorter than intended.
